titleStmt.title: The defence of death Contayning a moste excellent discourse of life and death, vvritten in Frenche by Philip de Mornaye Gentleman. And doone into English by E.A.
Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort. English
titleStmt.author: Mornay, Philippe de, seigneur du Plessis-Marly, 1549-1623.
Aggas, Edward.
Seneca, Lucius Annaæs, ca 4 B.C.-65 A.D. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Allde for Edward Aggas dwelling in Paules Churchyarde at the signe of the red Dragon,

notesStmt.note: A translation, by Edward Aggas, of: Mornay, Philippe de. Excellent discours de la vie et de la mort.
"Certain collections gathered out of the works of the lerned philosopher Seneca" has caption title on E5r.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
